Corp","orientation":"0","keywords":["paypal headquarters","honey science corporation","tech industry","electronic payment","ecommerce","george ruan","ryan hudson","honey ceo","shopping rewards","online payment","online banking","money transfering","international money transfer"]},"filesize":7210949},"source_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/02\/GettyImages-1184251295.jpg","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2109236"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/attachment"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2109236"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/133574269"}]}}],"wp:term":[[{"id":576601119,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/cryptocurrency\/","name":"Cryptocurrency","slug":"cryptocurrency","taxonomy":"category","parent":0,"rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"submenu_categories":[],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories\/576601119"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?categories=576601119"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?categories=576601119"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=576601119"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[{"id":576861939,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/curv\/","name":"Curv","slug":"curv","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576861939"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576861939"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576861939"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576861939"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576861939"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":1511,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/paypal\/","name":"PayPal","slug":"paypal","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/1511"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=1511"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=1511"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=1511"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=1511"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2122530,"date":"2021-03-08T13:45:36","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T21:45:36","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2122530"},"modified":"2021-03-08T14:55:55","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T22:55:55","slug":"zapier-buys-no-code-focused-makerpad-in-its-first-acquisition","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/zapier-buys-no-code-focused-makerpad-in-its-first-acquisition\/","title":{"rendered":"Zapier buys no-code-focused Makerpad in its first acquisition"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><a href=\"https:\/\/zapier.com\/\">Zapier<\/a>, a well-known no-code automation tool, has purchased <a href=\"https:\/\/www.makerpad.co\/\">Makerpad<\/a>, a no-code education service and community. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.<\/p>\n<p>TechCrunch has covered Zapier often during its life, including its first, and only, fundraising event, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2012\/10\/31\/zapier-raises-1-2m-seed-round\/\">a $1.2 million round<\/a> back in 2012 that tapped Bessemer, DFJ and others. Since then the company has <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/05\/04\/zapier-launches-250month-team-accounts\/\">added more expensive tiers to its service<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2017\/10\/31\/zapier-makes-it-easier-for-teams-to-collaborate-on-their-app-workflows\/\">built out team-focused features<\/a>, and recently <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/03\/09\/zapier-ceo-wade-foster-on-scaling-a-remote-team-up-to-300-employees\/\">talked to Extra Crunch<\/a> about how it scaled its remote-only team.<\/p>\n<p>In an interview Monday, Zapier CEO <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/wadefoster?lang=en\">Wade Foster<\/a> told TechCrunch that his company now has 400 workers and crossed the $100 million ARR mark last summer.<\/p>\n<p>The Makerpad deal is its first acquisition. TechCrunch asked Makerpad founder <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/bentossell\">Ben Tossell<\/a> about the structure of the deal, who said via email that his company will operate as a &#8220;stand-alone&#8221; entity from its new parent company.<\/p>\n<p>The deal doesn&#8217;t seem prepped to upend what the smaller startup was working on before it was signed. &#8220;Ultimately,&#8221; Tossell wrote, &#8220;Makerpad&#8217;s vision is to educate as many people as possible on the possibilities of building without writing code.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>Foster seems content with that focus, describing to TechCrunch how he intends to let Makerpad operate largely independently, albeit inside a set of editorial guidelines.<\/p>\n<p>TechCrunch asked the Makerpad founder why this was the right time to sell his business. He said that the pairing would help his team take the no-code world farther than it could alone, also noting that the deal was a &#8220;no-brainer&#8221; over &#8220;alternative routes such as VC funding.&#8221;<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"c4sAZJYuus\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/07\/21\/tracking-the-growth-of-low-code-no-code-startups\/\">Tracking the growth of low-code, no-code startups<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Tracking the growth of low-code, no-code startups&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/07\/21\/tracking-the-growth-of-low-code-no-code-startups\/embed\/#?secret=c4sAZJYuus\" data-secret=\"c4sAZJYuus\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>The acquisition was partially driven by a single tweet. <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/smalter\/status\/1305964910866771969\">This one<\/a>, in fact. According to Tossell, the CEO of Zapier reached out after reading it, leading to conversations and a deal. Foster expanded on the story during a call, saying that he had long followed Tossell&#8217;s work and that the two had met previously at dinners. The tweet wound up in his Slack, he said, so he reached out to the Makerpad founder, and from there it was a pretty quick ramp to a deal.<\/p>\n<p>The two companies have seen rapid growth in recent quarters. Foster detailed to TechCrunch how small businesses have become increasingly reliant on his company&#8217;s service in the post-COVID world, with Zapier seeing strong SMB adoption after the pandemic hit. Given the digital transformation&#8217;s acceleration, that&#8217;s a trend that likely won&#8217;t slow soon. And Tossell told TechCrunch that no-code has already &#8220;grown bigger than [he] had imagined it could,&#8221; with his company seeing users expanding 4x in just under the last year.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"34BLMCvUwu\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/08\/22\/five-vcs-talk-about-how-no-code-is-going-horizontal-across-the-worlds-industries\/\">Five VCs discuss how no-code is going horizontal across the world\u2019s industries<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Five VCs discuss how no-code is going horizontal across the world\u2019s industries&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/08\/22\/five-vcs-talk-about-how-no-code-is-going-horizontal-across-the-worlds-industries\/embed\/#?secret=34BLMCvUwu\" data-secret=\"34BLMCvUwu\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>Zapier, perhaps one of the largest success stories in the broad swath of technology products that we might call the no-code world, now has an attached community that could help directly add users to its service, and perhaps indirectly by making the aggregate pool of no-coders larger over time.<\/p>\n<p>The no-code space has been active in recent months, as has its sibling niche, the low-code market. The latter has seen <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/17\/low-code-focused-outsystems-raises-150m-at-a-9-5b-valuation\/\">recent rounds in the nine figures<\/a>, as some corporations turn to low-code tools to help them more quickly build internal software. The no-code world has its own successes, like Zapier&#8217;s nine-figure revenues.<\/p>\n<p>Foster was neutral on more acquisitions, neither closing the door on them when TechCrunch asked, but not opening it any wider at the same time. On the SPAC question, however, the CEO was a bit clearer. That&#8217;s a no.<\/p>\n<p>After having <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/01\/26\/stacker-raises-1-7m-to-help-nocoders-build-apps-from-spreadsheets\/\">spoken to a grip of no-code<\/a>\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/22\/creatio-raises-68m-as-the-low-code-space-keeps-attracting-huge-checks\/\">and low-code founders<\/a> <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/08\/22\/five-vcs-talk-about-how-no-code-is-going-horizontal-across-the-worlds-industries\/\">and investors<\/a> in recent months, it seems clear that the broader business market is coming around to low-code services and that smaller companies have been quick adopters of no-code tooling. As low-code tools become increasingly abstracted from coding, and no-code tools add functionality, perhaps we&#8217;ll see the two related categories merge.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"bYg6svACOU\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/03\/09\/zapier-ceo-wade-foster-on-scaling-a-remote-team-up-to-300-employees\/\">Zapier CEO Wade Foster on scaling a remote team up to 300 employees<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Zapier CEO Wade Foster on scaling a remote team up to 300 employees&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/03\/09\/zapier-ceo-wade-foster-on-scaling-a-remote-team-up-to-300-employees\/embed\/#?secret=bYg6svACOU\" data-secret=\"bYg6svACOU\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Zapier, a well-known no-code automation tool, has purchased Makerpad, a no-code education service and community. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. TechCrunch has covered Zapier often during its life, including its first, and only, fundraising event, a $1.2 million round back in 2012 that tapped Bessemer, DFJ and others. Since then the company has om\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=578044"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=578044"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=578044"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2122507,"date":"2021-03-08T13:19:03","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T21:19:03","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2122507"},"modified":"2021-03-08T14:48:41","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T22:48:41","slug":"white-label-voice-assistants-will-win-the-battle-for-podcast-discovery","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/white-label-voice-assistants-will-win-the-battle-for-podcast-discovery\/","title":{"rendered":"White-label voice assistants will win the battle for podcast discovery"},"content":{"rendered":"<div class=\"article__contributor-byline-wrapper\">\n<div class=\"article__contributor-byline\">\n\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__contributor\">\n\t\t<div class=\"byline__author\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-name\">Amir Hirsh<\/span>\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<span class=\"byline__author-title\" style=\"display: block;\">Contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t\t\t<div class=\"contributor__twitter\">\n\t\t\t<a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/audioburst\">\n\t\t\t\t\t<svg class=\"icon icon--twitter icon--white\" viewBox=\"0 0 20 20\" version=\"1.1\" aria-labelledby=\"title\">\n\t\t<title>Share on Twitter<\/title>\n\t\t<path d=\"M20,4c-0.7,0.3-1.5,0.6-2.4,0.7c0.9-0.5,1.5-1.4,1.8-2.3c-0.8,0.5-1.7,0.8-2.6,1C16.1,2.5,15,2,13.8,2c-2.3,0-4.1,1.9-4.1,4.2c0,0.3,0,0.7,0.1,1C6.4,7,3.4,5.4,1.4,2.9C1,3.5,0.8,4.1,0.8,4.9c0,1.4,0.7,2.7,1.8,3.5C2,8.4,1.4,8.2,0.8,7.9v0.1c0,2,1.4,3.7,3.3,4.1c-0.4,0.1-0.7,0.2-1.1,0.2c-0.3,0-0.5,0-0.8-0.1c0.5,1.7,2,2.9,3.8,2.9c-1.4,1.1-3.2,2-5.1,2c-0.3,0-0.7,0-1-0.1c1.8,1.2,4,1.7,6.3,1.7c7.5,0,11.7-6.4,11.7-12V6.1C18.8,5.6,19.4,4.8,20,4z\"\/>\t<\/svg>\n\t\t\t\t<\/a>\n\t\t<\/div>\n\t\t\t<\/div>\n\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__bio\">\n\t\tAmir Hirsh is the CEO of <a href=\"https:\/\/www.audioburst.com\/\">AudioBurst<\/a>.\t<\/div>\n\t\n\t\t<div class=\"contributor-byline__more-articles\">\n\t\t<span class=\"more-articles-title\">More posts by this contributor<\/span>\n\t\t<ul class=\"more-articles-list\">\n\t\t\t\t\t\t<li><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2016\/07\/20\/powering-the-golden-age-of-audio\/\">Powering the golden age of audio<\/a><\/li>\n\t\t\t\t\t<\/ul>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/div>\n<\/div><p id=\"speakable-summary\"><span class=\"featured__span-first-words\">Americans are bored<\/span>, housebound and screened out. This has created a golden opportunity for audio as consumers turn to podcasts, voice assistants and smart speakers \u2014 often at the same time.<\/p>\n<p>Roughly 128 million Americans use a voice assistant\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/www.emarketer.com\/content\/voice-assistant-and-smart-speaker-users-2020\">at least once a month<\/a>. Smartphones account for most voice assistants, but there are also\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/marketingland.com\/roughly-1-in-4-u-s-adults-now-owns-a-smart-speaker-according-to-new-report-273994\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https:\/\/www.google.com\/url?q=https:\/\/marketingland.com\/roughly-1-in-4-u-s-adults-now-owns-a-smart-speaker-according-to-new-report-273994&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1615316037338000&amp;usg=AFQjCNE7XyfWLp9_d5MaFpOP3194pzC8zw\">nearly 160 million smart speakers in American homes.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-block block--pullout block--left\">\n\t\t<blockquote>\n\t\t\tHundreds of hardware and software makers are not easily ceding control of their users to the tech giants, and instead are seeking to introduce their own solutions.\t\t\t\t\t<\/blockquote>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/p>\n<p>One of the hottest forms of audio content is, of course, podcasts. Listeners have never had so many choices for smart and compelling podcast content, with new exciting shows emerging daily. On the consumption side, monthly podcast listeners\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/www.edisonresearch.com\/the-infinite-dial-2020\/\">topped 100 million<\/a>\u00a0for the first time in 2020, a 40% increase in just two years.<\/p>\n<p>Listeners get their podcasts from dedicated podcast apps (such as Stitcher), publisher apps (like NPR\u2019s), music apps (such as Spotify), or their default phone app or voice assistant. With more than <a href=\"https:\/\/www.podcastinsights.com\/podcast-statistics\/\">1.7 million podcasts<\/a> being produced today, even the most dedicated podcast listeners can\u2019t listen to every episode in their queue.<\/p>\n<p>This is where voice assistants come in.<\/p>\n<p>The major voice assistants \u2014 Amazon, Apple, Google, Microsoft and Samsung \u2014 dominate, but they face increasing competition for users from white-label voice assistants. This has become a battle that will be decided by whichever company can provide the best quality of service.<\/p>\n<p>That\u2019s why the voice assistant that can personalize podcasts and help listeners search, sample and discover content through shareable bite-sized pieces will win the voice wars.<\/p>\n<h2>A familiar battle over users<\/h2>\n<p>Early consumer electronics battles for users were waged over the operating system \u2014 Windows vs. Mac. Voice is another form of operating system and the battle over voice is no less fierce.<\/p>\n<p>Apple\u2019s Siri was the first modern virtual assistant to reach the masses. Amazon and Google have also heavily invested \u2014\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/hbr.org\/2019\/05\/why-tech-giants-are-so-desperate-to-provide-your-voice-assistant\">often at a loss<\/a> \u2014\u00a0to own voice activation for users, grab market share and protect their turf (e-commerce for Amazon and search for Google).<\/p>\n<p>Amazon took\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/www.wsj.com\/articles\/samsung-opens-its-voice-assistant-to-developers-as-it-pursues-alexa-and-siri-1541151843\">24% of the virtual assistant market in 2018<\/a>, followed by Apple (22%), Google (20%), Microsoft\u2019s Cortana (10%) (largely confined to desktop) and Samsung\u2019s Bixby (6%).<\/p>\n<p>These five major brands were early pioneers, but the next phase of the voice wars will be white-labeled, with voice assistants incorporated into all devices and brands.<\/p>\n<h2>The rise of white-label voice assistants<\/h2>\n<p>Unable to develop their own voice assistants, hundreds of device manufacturers must resort to Google or Alexa if they want to add voice functionality to their products. But in a way, this is a Trojan horse: Adding Google or Alexa voice enhances products but undermines user relationships.<div through sharable bite-sized pieces will win the voice assistant","slug":"virtual-assistant","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/186372"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=186372"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=186372"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=186372"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=186372"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":66337398,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/voice-assistant\/","name":"voice assistant","slug":"voice-assistant","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/66337398"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=66337398"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=66337398"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=66337398"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=66337398"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[{"id":576796356,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/extracrunch\/market-analysis\/","name":"Market Analysis","slug":"market-analysis","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796356"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796356"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[]]}},{"id":2122408,"date":"2021-03-08T12:02:15","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T20:02:15","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2122408"},"modified":"2021-03-08T14:06:06","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T22:06:06","slug":"announcing-the-agenda-for-tc-early-stage-operations-fundraising","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/announcing-the-agenda-for-tc-early-stage-operations-fundraising\/","title":{"rendered":"Announcing the agenda for TC Early Stage \u2014 Operations &#038; Fundraising"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">As an early-stage founder, how do you identify the right investors? Or know how to hire the best possible team to set up your company for growth? Should you bootstrap, and if so, how do you do it successfully? How do you nail virtual pitch meetings? What about product-market fit? Board construction and good governance? How do you make sound financial decisions both for your company and yourself?<\/p>\n<p id=\"speakable-summary\">You\u2019ve got questions. <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/?promo=agendapost\">TechCrunch Early Stage<\/a> will have answers for you on April 1 and 2.<\/p>\n<p>At the virtual event, we\u2019re bringing together some of the most seasoned operators in the fields of legal, recruiting, product, data security and sales to help you find your way through a tactical quagmire to the bright light of success at the end of the tunnel.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>Of course, the show will cover more than operational challenges. We also have many, many\u00a0sessions around fundraising, from how to think about raising your Series A to how to get an investors attention.<br \/>\nIf you\u2019re in the midst of building a company, this show is worth making time for. Plus, audience members will be able to ask expert speakers their own questions to in each and every breakout session.<\/p>\n<h2>Finding Your Product-Market Fit (Sean Lane \u2014 Olive AI)<\/h2>\n<p>Olive AI founder and CEO is no stranger to the pivot. Hear how he practiced patience in the search for product-market fit, how he knew it when he finally found it and tactics he used to build on it.<\/p>\n<h2>How to Get an Investor&#8217;s Attention (Marlon Nichols \u2014 MaC Venture Capital)<\/h2>\n<p>Marlon Nichols is an expert in early-stage investments, having invested in countless successful ventures such as Gimlet Media, MongoDB, Thrive Market, PlayVS, Fair, Wonderschool and Finesse. Right now, there is more seed-stage fundraising than ever before, and Marlon will speak on how to get noticed by investors, how to grow your business and how to survive in the crowded, competitive space of tech startups. He will provide insights on how to network, craft a great pitch and target the best investors for your success.<\/p>\n<h2>How to Nail Your Virtual Pitch Meeting (Melissa Bradley \u2014 Ureeka)<\/h2>\n<p>The rules of the pitch meeting have changed. Instead of traveling across the country, wasting time in planes, trains and automobiles, founders can take upward of 30 meetings in a day from the comfort of their home. Entrepreneur and VC Melissa Bradley will outline how to make the most of that half hour on Zoom and lock in the next one.<\/p>\n<h2>10 Things NOT To Do When You Are Starting a Company (Leah Solivan \u2014 Fuel Capital)<\/h2>\n<p>With voices across the internet giving their two cents on how to run a great business, Fuel Capital&#8217;s Leah Solivan, who was CEO at TaskRabbit for eight years, will share a list of things that a founder should NOT do. Avoid the pitfalls that could break your momentum, or worst case, your company and ask Solivan your own questions.<\/p>\n<h2>How To Get Into An Accelerator (Neal Sales-Griffin \u2014 Techstars)<\/h2>\n<p>Accelerators provide an incredible launch pad for early-stage startups, offering a built-in network, accessible advisors, and of course, capital. But first, you&#8217;ve got to be accepted. Hear Techstars&#8217; Neal Sales-Griffin outline how to get into an accelerator and make the most of the experience.<\/p>\n<h2>4 Things To Think About Before Raising a Series A (Bucky Moore \u2014 Kleiner Perkins)<\/h2>\n<p>Founders looking to raise Series A capital know that it&#8217;s an entirely different ball game than seed-stage funding. Hear Kleiner Perkins partner Bucky Moore outline the most important ways to mentally prepare for heading into Series A fundraising.<\/p>\n<h2>How to Build Your Early Team for Future Growth (Sarah Smith \u2014 Bain Capital Ventures)<\/h2>\n<p>More than your investors, or even you as a founder, your early employees will have a tremendous influence on the trajectory of your company. You hire them, and oftentimes, they hire everyone else. Hear Bain Capital Ventures partner Sarah Smith talk through how to recruit a top-notch early team that sets your startup up for future growth.<\/p>\n<h2>Contracts, Cap Tables and other Legal Questions (Dawn Belt \u2014 Fenwick)<\/h2>\n<p>No matter the industry, your startup requires legal help. Whether it&#8217;s building out the cap table, writing up contracts, understanding the laws around hiring or simply feeling secure with a TOS. Whatever the question, Fenwick partner Dawn Belt has the answer.<\/p>\n<h2>Finance for Founders (Alexa von Tobel \u2014 Inspired Capital)<\/h2>\n<p>As a founder, you not only have to master your company&#8217;s finances, you also have to tackle your own personal finances. Managing your money as a founder comes with a unique set of questions (see: QSBS). Leveraging her expertise from LearnVest and as a Certified Financial Planner\u2122, Alexa will share financial planning best practices so founders can remove this layer of stress from the pressure of building a business.<\/p>\n<h2>Leadership Culture and Good Governance (David Easton \u2014 Generation Investment Management)<\/h2>\n<p>David Easton is a growth-stage partner at Generation Investment Management with portfolio companies that include Asana, Andela, Gusto and Docusign, among others. Easton will talk through how to choose your board and foster a leadership culture that keeps sustainable, good governance top of mind.<\/p>\n<h2>Building and Leading a Sales Team (Ryan Azus \u2014 Zoom)<\/h2>\n<p>Contrary to popular opinion, even the very best products don&#8217;t sell themselves. Salespeople do. Hear from Zoom&#8217;s chief revenue officer, at the helm of the company&#8217;s sales team during the biggest period of growth of any software company ever, lay out how to build a stellar sales team.<\/p>\n<h2>The All-22 View (Eghosa Omoigui \u2014 EchoVC Partners)<\/h2>\n<p>Improving line of sight and dynamic field of play aperture is rarely discussed but hugely important. Great founders, operators and investors have an understanding of playbooks on both sides of the ball. We&#8217;ll talk through lessons and some ideas on how to build muscle memory and skillsets so that founders never lose perspective when it&#8217;s time to make a big decision.<\/p>\n<p>And we&#8217;ll also have some great sessions from our partners too!<\/p>\n<h2>Creating and Protecting IP Value in Connection with VC Financings (brought to you by <a href=\"http:\/\/www.perkinscoie.com\/\">Perkins Coie<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>How do venture capital investors value formal intellectual property (IP) rights in connection with a decision to fund a technology or life sciences startup? How do they conduct IP due diligence? How do investors and founders, post-funding, ensure their startups are pursuing an IP strategy that optimizes exit valuation for all? Perkins Coie partners Michael Glenn (Patent Prosecution) and Matt Oshinsky (Emerging Companies Venture Capital) will be joined alongside a seasoned venture capitalist to discuss these and other questions regarding safeguarding IP rights and maximizing the value of all technology development activities.<\/p>\n<h2>Scientist Entrepreneurs \u2014 Scaling Breakout Engineering Biology Companies (brought to you by <a href=\"https:\/\/www.mayfield.com\/\">Mayfield<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>Biology as technology will reinvent trillion dollar industries and enhance human and planetary evolution. In this session, two early-stage investors and company builders, Arvind Gupta and Ursheet Parikh, will be in conversation with leading author and seed investor Po Bronson, managing director of IndieBio. They will share their playbook on scaling startups touching upon three seminal areas that influence trajectory\u2014 fundraising, hiring and product design. Their insights will draw on their experience with companies including ingredients-as-a-service leader Geltor, which raised a $91 million Series B in 2020; CRISPR platform Mammoth Biosciences, whose dream team includes Nobel Laureate co-founder Jennifer Doudna; and Endpoint Health, started by the founding team of GeneWEAVE (acquired by Roche) and former YC Bio Partner Diego Rey, which is designing a new class of therapeutic products that focus on hospital conditions that kill as many people as cancer.<\/p>\n<h2>Using Fast Feedback to Make Higher-Confidence Decisions and Accelerate the Dev Process (brought to you by <a href=\"https:\/\/www.usertesting.com\/\">UserTesting<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>We&#8217;ll discuss how to use fast feedback methodologies to make high-confidence product decisions based on objective customer data in real time, without slowing the dev process. Quickly diagnose problems, settle disputes, reduce the risk of rework and iterate faster. This session will include real-world case studies.<\/p>\n<h2>An M&amp;A Playbook for Startup Founders: Lessons from Google and Microsoft (brought to you by <a href=\"http:\/\/www.meruscap.com\/\">Merus Capital<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>One of the most important decisions a founding team can make is when to consider selling the company to a strategic buyer. In this session, learn the tactics for approaching acquirers, avoiding common pitfalls and maximizing the likelihood of achieving an eye-popping valuation. Hear from Sean Dempsey, founding partner of Merus Capital who spent 10 years leading acquisitions for Google and Microsoft, and Dave Sobota, VP of Corporate Development at Instacart and former M&amp;A leader at Google.<\/p>\n<h2>Why Founders Should Adopt OKRs Now? (brought to you by <a href=\"https:\/\/dell.to\/TechCrunch\">Dell for Entrepreneurs<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>Execution is key to a startup&#8217;s survival and growth especially when it comes to fast-moving software and technology products. Being in the tricky intersection of investors, customers and employees, a founder needs to balance priorities, align teams and create a visionary product that works. Moreover, in this age of hyperfeedback loops and changing business models, the founder has to be agile enough to absorb and quickly react to changes in the product roadmap and consumer needs. OKRs \u2014 a toolkit used mostly by engineering and product teams is more than relevant now for founders of all kinds to embrace. Join the session to learn the history of OKRs, what they are about and witness case studies of successful real-life adoption.<\/p>\n<h2>Naming and Protecting Your Company\u2019s Intellectual Property (brought to you by <a href=\"http:\/\/www.brainbase.com\/\">Brainbase<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>You have an idea for a game-changing product or service \u2014 what do you call it? Once you\u2019ve picked a name, how do you make sure nobody else is using it? Is the domain and Twitter handle available? Brainbase makes it easy for anyone to file a trademark without a lawyer and instantly own your brand across all channels. In this session, Brainbase co-founder and CEO Nate Cavanaugh will explain the importance of owning your company\u2019s trademark, both for brand protection and for fundraising due diligence.<\/p>\n<h2>Nailing the Little Things: How Startups Can Achieve Operational Excellence from &#8220;Day One&#8221; (brought to you by <a href=\"https:\/\/www.bcapgroup.com\/\">B Capital Group<\/a>)<\/h2>\n<p>The early days of launching a company can be a whirlwind for founding teams as unexpected challenges and opportunities require flexibility, agility and speed. But implementing a few key operating best practices and processes early can be a crucial part of a startup&#8217;s success or failure when it prepares for rapid growth. Join partners from B Capital Group, a multistage global investor, to learn about the most important things you can do to set your startup up for success early in your journey, and what will be most important to investors as you raise your Seed, A and B funding rounds. Speakers include Howard Morgan, chairman of B Capital Group and co-founder of First Round Capital, and partners Karen Page (formerly of Box) and Gabe Greenbaum (formerly of Pritzker Group).<\/p>\n<p>This year, we\u2019ve <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/02\/03\/announcing-the-tc-early-stage-pitch-off\/\">added a pitch-off<\/a> on day 2 of <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/?promo=agendapost\">TC Early Stage<\/a>, showcasing interesting startups from a variety of sectors. All-star judges will give their feedback live. You don\u2019t want to miss it! And if you&#8217;re interested in pitching, you can still <a href=\"https:\/\/tc692057.typeform.com\/to\/jNejpAvG\">apply to pitch by tomorrow, March 9<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Of course,\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/?promo=quorapost&amp;display=true\">TC Early Stage<\/a> dual event ticket holders will get access to both events (April 1-2 and July 8-9) and have access to 2x the content that comes out of the event live or on demand. Plus, you can take advantage of additional savings with <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/?promo=quorapost&amp;display=true\">early-bird pricing<\/a> on dual event tickets until March 26!<\/p>\n<p>Mercenary CEOs know all too well that this is about the most bang you can get for your buck. Period. Grab <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/events\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/?promo=quorapost&amp;display=true\">your ticket now and save up to author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/70113879"}]}}],"wp:term":[[{"id":17396,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tc\/","name":"TC","slug":"tc","taxonomy":"category","parent":0,"rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"submenu_categories":[],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories\/17396"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?categories=17396"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?categories=17396"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=17396"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[],[{"id":576831922,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/event-type\/early-stage\/tc-early-stage-2021-part-1\/","name":"TC Early Stage 2021 - Operations &amp; Fundraising","slug":"tc-early-stage-2021-part-1","taxonomy":"tc_event","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_event\/576831922"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_event"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_event"}],"up":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_event\/576715145"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_event=576831922"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_events?tc_event=576831922"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tc_event=576831922"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}]]}},{"id":2121522,"date":"2021-03-08T11:34:40","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T19:34:40","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2121522"},"modified":"2021-03-08T13:00:49","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T21:00:49","slug":"from-electric-charging-to-supply-chain-management-inmotion-ventures-preps-jaguar-for-a-sustainable-future","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/from-electric-charging-to-supply-chain-management-inmotion-ventures-preps-jaguar-for-a-sustainable-future\/","title":{"rendered":"From electric charging to supply chain management, InMotion Ventures preps Jaguar for a sustainable future"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><span class=\"featured__span-first-words\">Since <a href=\"https:\/\/www.inmotionventures.com\/\">InMotion Ventures<\/span><\/a>, the independent investment and incubation initiative set up by <a href=\"https:\/\/www.jaguarlandrover.com\/\">Jaguar Land Rover<\/a>, launched in 2016 the firm has focused on backing companies across the mobility space broadly. Its 15 active investments run the gamut from autonomous vehicles, to car insurance tech, to ride-sharing, and travel planning, but increasingly the firm is focusing its efforts on vehicle electrification and sustainable supply chains.<\/p>\n<p>\t<div class=\"article-block block--pullout block--right\">\n\t\t<blockquote>\n\t\t\tAs the mobility market moves to embrace electrification, InMotion wants to make sure its portfolio is in the mix.\t\t\t\t\t<\/blockquote>\n\t<\/div>\n\t<\/p>\n<p>That&#8217;s evident from its most recent investment in <a href=\"https:\/\/www.circulor.com\/\">Circulor<\/a>, a company that monitors supply chains from raw material inputs to finished outputs with an eye toward sustainable sourcing.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As an OEM nowadays it\u2019s increasingly important to have increasing transparency and visibility into how all of those materials have been sourced,&#8221; said the firm&#8217;s managing director, Sebastian Peck. Circulor already has a strong footprint in the automotive industry, Peck said, and is working with a major oil company on tracing the share of recycled plastics that have come from that provider. &#8220;It has applications across any industry.&#8221;<\/span><\/p>\n<p>Jaguar Land Rover is also using Circulor&#8217;s technology to track a material that&#8217;s being used in the interior of one of the company&#8217;s vehicles, Peck said. The stealthy project hasn&#8217;t been publicly revealed yet, but the company has worked with a university and supplier to trace the material from its point of origin to the finished product.<\/p>\n<p>Sustainable supply chains aren&#8217;t the only priorities Peck laid out in a recent interview with TechCrunch.<\/p>\n<p>As the mobility market moves to embrace electrification, InMotion wants to make sure its portfolio is in the mix and Peck said it would be looking to make investments in a number of different areas around electric vehicles and batteries.<\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#8220;We have looked at a number of companies who are developing new battery chemistries. We haven\u2019t made an investment yet,&#8221; Peck said. &#8220;We don\u2019t have a deep enough insight into the IP portfolios of the big battery suppliers to really be able to reliably benchmark those new chemistries. We have not had enough conviction to make an investment or back a particular company. From a value chain it is two or three steps away from us. It\u2019s a space we\u2019re looking at.&#8221;<\/span><\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_1947767\" style=\"width: 2310px\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-1947767\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"breakout wp-image-1947767 size-full\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"2300\" height=\"1449\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg 2300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=150,95 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=300,189 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=768,484 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=680,428 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=1536,968 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=2048,1290 2048w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/02\/Jaguar-Land-Rover-Mobility-Concept-1.jpg?resize=50,32 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 2300px) 100vw, 2300px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-1947767\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Jaguar Land Rover<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p><div class=\"extra-crunch-offer-container\"><\/div>","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>&#8220;Obviously, we venture beyond electrification into autonomous vehicles and connectivity. Analysis","slug":"market-analysis","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796356"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796356"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[]]}},{"id":2122346,"date":"2021-03-08T10:47:28","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T18:47:28","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2122346"},"modified":"2021-03-08T11:50:37","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T19:50:37","slug":"cosi-raises-e20m","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/cosi-raises-e20m\/","title":{"rendered":"Cosi raises \u20ac20M for its &#8216;full-stack&#8217; approach to short-term rentals"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\"><a href=\"https:\/\/www.cosi-group.com\/\">Cosi Group<\/a>, a Berlin-based startup offering an alternative to boutique hotels and managed short-stay apartments, is disclosing \u20ac20 million in new investment.<\/p>\n<p>Backing the round is Vienna-based Soravia, a leading real estate group in German-speaking countries. Existing investors Cherry Ventures, e.ventures, Kreos Capital and Bremke followed on, along with a number of individual investors. They are described as including the founders of Flixbus, Travelperk, Comtravo and Cosi&#8217;s own founders.<\/p>\n<p>Cosi says it will use the fresh capital to accelerate international expansion in Europe, implement a new brand and launch a &#8220;new strategic business unit&#8221; soon.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"iAvqWbzAFw\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/08\/21\/cosi\/\">Cosi raises \u20ac5M for its &#8216;full-stack&#8217; hospitality alternative to boutique hotels<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Cosi raises \u20ac5M for its &#8216;full-stack&#8217; hospitality alternative to boutique hotels&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2019\/08\/21\/cosi\/embed\/#?secret=iAvqWbzAFw\" data-secret=\"iAvqWbzAFw\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>Originally described as a tech-enabled or \u201cfull-stack\u201d hospitality service that competes with well-run boutique hotels or traditional local managed apartments, the company signs long-term leases with property owners, and then furnishes those apartments itself to \u201ccontrol\u201d the interior design experience. It claims to have digitised, and where possible, automated its processes in order to scale and maintain quality of service throughout the guest journey, from initial contact to loyalty.<\/p>\n<p>Christian Gaiser, CEO of Cosi, tells me the startup has not only been able to mitigate the pandemic &#8212; which has seen major restrictions in travel, including countries going into full lockdown &#8212; but actually thrive. That&#8217;s because Cosi was able to tap &#8220;new demand channels&#8221; that aren&#8217;t reliant on holiday travel or short business trips.<\/p>\n<p>Described as &#8220;midstay&#8221; (guests that stay for one month or longer), examples include people who arrive in a city and need a home for one or two months until they find a longer-term apartment, citizens who need to get away from shared apartments (perhaps to be less at risk or to work from home), or families who are building or renovating a house that faces construction delays due to the pandemic.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;Thus, we were able to reach over 90% occupancy and managed to operate our locations on a cash-flow-positive scale,&#8221; adds the Cosi CEO. &#8220;Lesson learned for us: Even when almost all your demand channels dry out, you still can do a lot if you focus on what you can control. We simply activated new demand channels.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>In addition, he says the pandemic has accelerated a shift in demand preferences, seeing &#8220;big hotel bunkers&#8221; become less popular versus individual apartment style accommodations.<\/p>\n<p>Meanwhile, Cosi has also seen a &#8220;massive boost in supply,&#8221; with lots of takeover opportunities in the hotel space, especially for underperforming hotel properties. And since office space demand has contracted dramatically, the company is receiving offers to convert office space for use as midstay accommodation.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;On the back of our strong COVID performance, we&#8217;ve built a lot of trust among the real estate community and receive more and more offers,&#8221; says Gaiser. &#8220;Prices for supply have fallen sometimes dramatically, depending on the city, due to these factors&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>To that end, Cosi currently has 750 units under contract, with 1,500 more under negotiation.<\/p>\n<p>Adds the Cosi CEO: &#8220;Now is exactly the right timing to double down on Cosi&#8217;s growth from a long-term perspective. When everyone is scared\/shocked, you can win big if you have a clear plan. Our investors bought into this plan, as we have demonstrated that our business model is resilient and we also have the capacity to navigate the ship both in good but also in rough waters.&#8221;<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"BYafrQt6TC\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/01\/corporate-sustainability-initiatives-may-open-doors-for-carbon-offset-startups\/\">Corporate sustainability initiatives may open doors for carbon offset startups<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Corporate sustainability initiatives may open doors for carbon offset startups&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/01\/corporate-sustainability-initiatives-may-open-doors-for-carbon-offset-startups\/embed\/#?secret=BYafrQt6TC\" data-secret=\"BYafrQt6TC\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Cosi Group, a Berlin-based startup offering an alternative to boutique hotels and managed short-stay apartments, is disclosing \u20ac20 million in new investment. Backing the round is Vienna-based Soravia, a leading real estate group in German-speaking countries. Existing investors Cherry Ventures, e.ventures, Kreos Capital and Bremke followed on, along with a number of individual investors. They O'Hear is best known as a technology journalist, currently at TechCrunch where he focuses on European startups, companies and products.<\/p>\n\n<p>He first joined TechCrunch in November 2009 as Contributing Editor for TechCrunch Europe, where he worked alongside Editor Mike Butcher to help build TechCrunch's coverage in Europe.<\/p>\n\n<p>In June 2011, Steve took a break from journalism to co-found the London and Prague-based startup Beepl. In his role as CEO, he helped the company raise its first VC round, along with seeing the Question & Answer site through development, private alpha and a high profile public launch. In November 2012, Beepl was acquired by Brand Embassy.<\/p>\n\n<p>Along with TechCrunch, Steve has written for numerous publications, including ZDNet (where he wrote the well-respected blog 'The Social Web'), The Guardian, Macworld, TES, Last100 and ReadWriteWeb. He also wrote and directed the critically acclaimed Silicon Valley documentary 'In Search of the Valley', which was released in September 2006.<\/p>\n\n<p>In 2002, Steve was made a fellow of the National Endowment for Science, Technology and the Arts. He's also one half of ProtoBake Labs, an 'ideas incubator' he co-founded with Pete Harris.<\/p>\n\n<p>Disclaimer: Steve owns a small amount of cryptocurrency, and doesn't generally write about crypto currencies. ts?categories=17396"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?categories=17396"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?categories=17396"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[{"id":576862019,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/cosi-group\/","name":"cosi group","slug":"cosi-group","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576862019"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576862019"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576862019"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576862019"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576862019"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2122352,"date":"2021-03-08T09:44:37","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T17:44:37","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2122352"},"modified":"2021-03-08T11:58:15","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T19:58:15","slug":"porter-roads-sustainable-whole-animal-butchery-raises-10-million-to-expand-across-the-u-s","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/porter-roads-sustainable-whole-animal-butchery-raises-10-million-to-expand-across-the-u-s\/","title":{"rendered":"Porter Road&#8217;s sustainable, whole animal butchery raises $10 million to expand across the US"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">In the nearly 10 years since it launched as a whole animal butchery out of a storefront in East Nashville, the founders of <a href=\"https:\/\/porterroad.com\/\">Porter Road<\/a> have wanted to <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/08\/30\/porter-road-was-to-herd-the-meat-industry-in-a-new-direction\/\">herd America&#8217;s meat industry down a new path<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Now the company has $10 million in financing from investors including L37 Ventures, River Park Ventures, Middleland, FJ Labs, Kelvin Beachum along with previous investors MAX Ventures, Tribeca Venture Partners and Slow Ventures to bring that mission to a broader swath of the country.<\/p>\n<p>Since the company bought its own slaughterhouse back in 2015 and expanded to e-commerce in 2018 it has been shipping its selections of lamb, beef, pork, chicken and sausages from local farms to tables across the U.S.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"RVs5Q67POy\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/08\/30\/porter-road-was-to-herd-the-meat-industry-in-a-new-direction\/\">Porter Road wants to herd the meat industry in a new direction<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Porter Road wants to herd the meat industry in a new direction&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/08\/30\/porter-road-was-to-herd-the-meat-industry-in-a-new-direction\/embed\/#?secret=RVs5Q67POy\" data-secret=\"RVs5Q67POy\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>The new money will be used to scale the company&#8217;s sustainable agriculture and its pasture-raised meat for the direct-to-consumer business, its shop in Nashville and for wholesale distribution to restaurants around the country.<\/p>\n<p>It&#8217;s going to expand its operations in Princeton, Kentucky with a new USDA processing facility that&#8217;s 4.5 times larger to meet new demand. That move will create 80 new jobs in the small town and is part of a broader agricultural renaissance in Kentucky.<\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#8220;It\u2019s easy to back founders who are as comfortable on the manufacturing line as they are<\/span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">in the boardroom, and who see the world differently and have the deep domain expertise to<\/span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">execute on that vision,&#8221; said L37 Partner Randall Ussery in a statement. &#8220;They have spent years perfecting the Porter Road way, which no<\/span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">company nor incumbent can replicate overnight. They are a category killer in the meat industry<\/span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">and have built a moat around their brand.&#8221;<\/span><\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2122380\" style=\"width: 1034px\" class=\"wp-caption alignnone\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2122380\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-full wp-image-2122380\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1024\" height=\"682\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg 2000w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg?resize=150,100 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg?resize=300,200 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg?resize=768,512 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg?resize=680,453 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg?resize=1536,1024 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Porter_Road_Hero_Box_Horiz.jpg?resize=50,33 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2122380\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Porter Road delivery box of a selection of its steaks, sausages and bacon. <strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Porter Road<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>One indication of the ways in which Porter Road differs from its larger competitors is in the way it handled the COVID-19 pandemic at its facilities.<\/p>\n<p>Due to its limited production schedule and measures like staggered break times, mask requirements and social distancing rules, the company was able to avoid having any outbreaks at its facilities, according to the company&#8217;s co-founder and chief executive, Chris Carter. &#8220;We had a handful of people who got sick, but [COVID-19] didn&#8217;t spread in Princeton,&#8221; said Carter.<\/p>\n<p>Despite the push for more plant-based diets, Carter says that his company&#8217;s focus on pasture-raised animals and whole animal butchery should appeal to folks who care about sustainable production. &#8220;We care about our farmers and we care about the way our animals are raised,&#8221; said Carter. &#8220;That&#8217;s the whole point of what we&#8217;re doing \u2026<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u00a0Porter Road is about animal utilization. It\u2019s about honoring the life of an animal so we find an outlet for every single piece.&#8221;<\/span><\/p>\n<p>Porter Road is expanding its product line into cooking tallow and fats, and cross-cut bones for bone marrow dishes, Carter said.<\/p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\u201cThe food system is broken and in need of a substantial change. Today\u2019s consumer is<\/span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">demanding a deeper level of connection to their food <\/span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">and can see past misleading labels and buzzwords,\u201d<\/span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">said Carter, in a statement. \u201c<\/span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">W<\/span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">e are delivering trust, transparency and flavor so no one has to compromise, all while supporting our farmers.\u201d<\/span><\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"JQKYz2Go5Y\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/17\/startups-in-energy-storage-housing-transportation-and-agriculture-could-see-boost-under-biden-plans\/\">Biden&#8217;s infrastructure plans could boost startups<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;Biden&#8217;s infrastructure plans could boost startups&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/11\/17\/startups-in-energy-storage-housing-transportation-and-agriculture-could-see-boost-under-biden-plans\/embed\/#?secret=JQKYz2Go5Y\" data-secret=\"JQKYz2Go5Y\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>In the nearly 10 years since it launched as a whole animal butchery out of a storefront in East Nashville, the founders of Porter Road have wanted to herd America&#8217;s meat industry down a new path. Now the company has $10 million in financing from investors including L37 Ventures, River Park Ventures, Middleland, FJ Labs, \/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576618928"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576618928"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576618928"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":85841814,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/slow-ventures\/","name":"slow ventures","slug":"slow-ventures","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/85841814"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=85841814"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=85841814"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=85841814"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=85841814"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":65465449,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/tribeca-venture-partners\/","name":"Tribeca Venture Partners","slug":"tribeca-venture-partners","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/65465449"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=65465449"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=65465449"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=65465449"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=65465449"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2122324,"date":"2021-03-08T09:38:40","date_gmt":"2021-03-08T17:38:40","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2122324"},"modified":"2021-03-08T12:07:14","modified_gmt":"2021-03-08T20:07:14","slug":"apple-teams-with-common-sense-media-to-curate-podcasts-for-kids","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/08\/apple-teams-with-common-sense-media-to-curate-podcasts-for-kids\/","title":{"rendered":"Apple teams with Common Sense Media to curate podcasts for kids"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Apple announced this morning it&#8217;s teaming up with Common Sense Media to curate a selection of kid-friendly podcasts in the U.S. in light of what appears to be growing interest in spoken-word entertainment among families. That interest, in part, may have been prompted by the pandemic and parents&#8217; desire to reduce kids&#8217; screen time for entertainment.<\/p>\n<p>Via a new website at <a href=\"http:\/\/apple.co\/showsforkids\">Apple.co\/showsforkids<\/a> (which launches Apple Podcasts), Apple has collaborated with Common Sense Media to group podcasts by age group as well as by theme. At launch, the collection features creators like Tinkercast, American Public Media, Gen-Z Media, Pinna, Tumble, Highlights, WNYC Studios, Rebel Girls and Nickelodeon, among others.<\/p>\n<p>In addition to groups by age, there are also four thematic collections available: <em>Common Sense Media Picks<\/em>, which are all-time family favorites; <em>One More!,<\/em> which features mysterious tales and action-packed dramas; <em>Kids Know Best<\/em>, which feature shows picked by kids themselves; and <em>Story Time<\/em>, which are story-driven shows.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2122364\" style=\"width: 690px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2122364\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"size-large wp-image-2122364\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?w=680\" alt=\"\" width=\"680\" height=\"483\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg 2794w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=150,107 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=300,213 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=768,545 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=680,483 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=1536,1091 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=2048,1454 2048w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/Screen-Shot-2021-03-08-at-12.28.04-PM.jpg?resize=50,36 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2122364\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> screenshot of Apple Podcasts<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>The site will be updated monthly to feature new and popular shows and to introduce timely collections around historical and cultural moments, like Women&#8217;s History Month or Back to School ideas, Apple says.<\/p>\n<p>The company also notes the selection of shows is curated using the same sort of research-backed approach that Common Sense Media applies to other entertainment, like TV shows, movies, books, apps and games.<\/p>\n<p>The launch follows <a href=\"https:\/\/www.macrumors.com\/2021\/03\/04\/apple-launches-apple-for-kids-support-page\/\">Apple&#8217;s recent debut of an &#8220;Apple for Kids&#8221; website<\/a> that helps parents set up devices for kids and learn about Family Sharing options, highlighting an increased interest in catering to the needs of families.<\/p>\n<p>But unlike with kids&#8217; use of Apple devices, the current market for kids&#8217; podcasts is small &#8212; none of Apple&#8217;s top 100 podcasts are directed toward kids, for example.<\/p>\n<p>However, industry experts believe the kids market may grow alongside the overall adult podcast market. Plus, as <a href=\"https:\/\/morningconsult.com\/2020\/11\/10\/podcasts-kids-parents-polling\/\">Morning Consult recently reported<\/a>, the COVID-19 pandemic has helped drive new interest in the audio format as parents struggled to keep kids entertained at home.<\/p>\n<p>Case in point: one leading kids&#8217; podcast, &#8220;Wow in the World&#8221; by NPR, saw a 94% increase in downloads in the 13 weeks post-COVID compared with pre-COVID, the report said.<\/p>\n<p>In another recent analysis, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.nationalpublicmedia.com\/insights\/reports\/the-spoken-word-audio-report\/\">NPR&#8217;s 2020 Spoken Word Audio Report<\/a> found that 15% of U.S. adults were now listening to children&#8217;s spoken word audio &#8212; an indication that many parents were already co-listening with kids. In addition, research from <a href=\"https:\/\/www.kidslisten.org\/\">Kids Listen<\/a>, a nonprofit advocacy group for kids&#8217; podcasts, found that 89% of kids who listen to podcasts are ages 8 or under, <a href=\"https:\/\/morningconsult.com\/2020\/11\/10\/podcasts-kids-parents-polling\/\">Morning Consult pointed out.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>Apple, it&#8217;s worth noting, has been rumored to be considering a new podcast subscription service to challenge Spotify, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.theinformation.com\/articles\/apple-plans-podcasting-subscription-service-in-threat-to-spotify\">The Information reported year earlier this year.<\/a> In the weeks since that report, Apple has seemingly begun to pay more attention to the format, having <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/01\/19\/apples-new-editorial-franchise-apple-podcasts-spotlight-to-highlight-interesting-creators\/\">launched a new editorial franchise, Apple Podcasts Spotlight,<\/a> to highlight interesting creators.<\/p>\n<p>Adding kids&#8217; programing could play into Apple&#8217;s future ambitions, perhaps, as 64% of parents who listen to podcasts said they&#8217;re likely to purchase a paid subscription to podcasts for their kids.<\/p>\n<p>The new collection is live in the U.S. in Apple Podcasts.<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"qJtFDakAWh\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/08\/04\/more-thoughts-on-growing-podcasts\/\">More thoughts on growing\u00a0podcasts<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;More thoughts on growing\u00a0podcasts&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/08\/04\/more-thoughts-on-growing-podcasts\/embed\/#?secret=qJtFDakAWh\" data-secret=\"qJtFDakAWh\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Apple announced this morning it&#8217;s teaming up with Common Sense Media to curate a selection of kid-friendly podcasts in the U.S. in light of what appears to be growing interest in spoken-word entertainment among families. That interest, in part, may have been prompted by the pandemic and parents&#8217; desire to reduce kids&#8217; screen time for [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":2414667,"featured_media":2122361,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"1a6c80e3-9e82-3cba-a05a-61b849989d6c"},"categories":[329026],"tags":[291,1343,37313,3374,1053,2060,45141,518],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/03\/unnamed-1.png","shortlink":"https:\/\/tcrn.ch\/3bqpTVv","rapidData":{"pt":"","pct":""},"premiumContent":false,"premiumCutoffPercent":1,"featured":false,"subtitle":"","seoTitle":"","seoDescription":"","tc_cb_mapping":[],"associatedEvent":null,"event":null,"authors":[2414667],"hide_featured_image":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2122324"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=2122324"}],"version-history":[{"count":3,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2122324\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":2122499,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/2122324\/revisions\/2122499"}],"authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/2414667"}],"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/edit":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-admin\/post.php?post=2122324&action=edit"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/tc\/v1\/users\/2414667"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/2122361"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=2122324"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"ca
